channel.title: Sprites wont work, help?
channel.description:
-------
Okay, so I'm using EasyRsc Source, which already comes with dragon armor from ID's 1314 - 1321.
First I spawned them, and it crashed the server. So I copied the ItemDef from my server side transfered to my client side. Okay, so now I can spawn them - I go to wield them, server crashes..
so I go into ItemWiedable.xml i add the int for the item idea's and i add i keep all the stats 1 so i can wield them to test them out.. do that, compile, run. okay i can wield them but they all show up in my inventory fine but wait... they are wielded on me as if i'm wearing iron armor?... I have no clue what to do to fix this, can anyone help me???

item.title: Sprites wont work, help?
item.dc:creator: @RSCShadow RSCShadow
item.description:
@RSCShadow wrote:

[quote="-Nothing, post:5, topic:393794"]Since we are talking about this, does anybody know what format is the color? like RGB, hex or what?[/quote]RGB. You can just take a hex and convert it to decimal and you’re good to go.

Read full topic

item.title: Sprites wont work, help?
item.dc:creator: @thegodmode thegodmode
item.description:
@thegodmode wrote:

Latifundio, thank you for your reply. Is there anyway that you could give me a brief tutorial how to make a dragon item such as “dragon chain” for example, and be able to weild it so it shows up as dragon chain? I’m having a LOT of trouble with this.

Read full topic

item.title: Sprites wont work, help?
item.dc:creator: @latifundio latifundio
item.description:
@latifundio wrote:

thegodmode:

I dont understand how animations work, could you explain to me?

Sure i will post how to change the sprites animations of an npc. For weildable items like armor try to change the color of some of the animation like mith platebody, then recompress the animations.rscd before running the client.

Lets look at the messed up “Chaos Druid Warrior” ID 555

Lol this guy has 2 sprites for legs! (see blue from the pants?) 

<NPCDef> 
    <name>Chaos Druid warrior</name> 
    <description>A crazy evil druid</description> 
    <command></command> 
    <attack>48</attack> 
    <strength>42</strength> 
    <hits>40</hits> 
    <defense>48</defense> 
    <attackable>true</attackable> 
    <aggressive>true</aggressive> 
    <respawnTime>30</respawnTime> 
    <sprites> 
      <int>6</int> 
      <int>1</int> 
      <int>2</int> 
      <int>-1</int> 
      <int>122</int> 
      <int>-1</int> 
      <int>84</int> 
      <int>42</int> 
      <int>-1</int> 
      <int>-1</int> 
      <int>-1</int> 
      <int>-1</int> 
    </sprites> 
    <hairColour>1</hairColour> 
    <topColour>65535</topColour> 
    <bottomColour>255</bottomColour> 
    <skinColour>15392466</skinColour> 
    <camera1>145</camera1> 
    <camera2>220</camera2>

3rd sprite is 2 (normal legs) bottom color is 255 (blue)
but in the 8th sprite is 42 (black platelegs) seems like someone forgot to -1 the 3rd sprite.
122 is staff, and 84 is top wizardrobe red…

Lets fix this guy with a black chain and a black mace and red robe bottom 

<NPCDef> 
    <name>Chaos Druid warrior</name> 
    <description>A crazy evil druid</description> 
    <command></command> 
    <attack>48</attack> 
    <strength>42</strength> 
    <hits>40</hits> 
    <defense>48</defense> 
    <attackable>true</attackable> 
    <aggressive>true</aggressive> 
    <respawnTime>30</respawnTime> 
    <sprites> 
      <int>6</int> 
      <int>1</int> 
      <int>2</int> 
      <int>-1</int> 
      <int>121</int> 
      <int>-1</int> 
      <int>26</int> 
      <int>90</int> 
      <int>-1</int> 
      <int>-1</int> 
      <int>-1</int> 
      <int>-1</int> 
    </sprites> 
    <hairColour>1</hairColour> 
    <topColour>15609904</topColour> 
    <bottomColour>255</bottomColour> 
    <skinColour>15392466</skinColour> 
    <camera1>145</camera1> 
    <camera2>220</camera2> 
    <walkModel>6</walkModel> 
    <combatModel>6</combatModel> 
    <combatSprite>5</combatSprite>

121 is black mace, 26 black chain, 90 robes bottom and i also changed the top color for the shirt to red (should now look more like a warrior-druid mix lol).

For bigger npc just increase camera1 and camera2 numbers.

Just remember, when u edit Npcs.rscd or Animations.rscd just recompress (i use 7zip) them before running the client againg.

Read full topic

item.title: Sprites wont work, help?

I dont understand how animations work, could you explain to me?

item.title: Sprites wont work, help?
item.dc:creator: @latifundio latifundio
item.description:
@latifundio wrote:

That would be in the animations.rscd (client) just extract the xml and edit it fixing the sprite color.

Look at the animation 178 for dmed, 16711748 is the color of the sprites.

  </AnimationDef>
    <AnimationDef>
    <name>mediumhelm</name>
    <charColour>16711748</charColour>
    <genderModel>0</genderModel>
    <hasA>true</hasA>
    <hasF>false</hasF>
    <number>0</number>
  </AnimationDef>

I attached an animations file with most of the ID number for easy editing npc ;D

Read full topic
